availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Carr (Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, physician. Tennessee native. Married to Jane M. Dallam Carr in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on November 30, 1843. Father of Kate F. Carr, George H. Carr, James Carr, and Lucien Carr. Married to Narcissa Carr. Physician in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Physician in Princeton in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 281A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 816.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 29.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 225B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644.
Find A Grave, "James A. Carr (1819-1882)," Memorial #83815505, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/83815505 (accessed March 17, 2021).
